Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were grown in 5% CO2 in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum containing penicillin (100 U/mL) and streptomycin (50 lg/mL).

Readout description.Molecular Effect: abolish the protective effect of wild-type PINK1 against staurosporine-induced apoptosis
Readout description.Result Description: After staurosporine treatment, cells overexpressing PINK1A244G showed significantly higher levels of apoptosis compared to wild-type PINK1.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: abolish the protective effect of wild-type PINK1 against staurosporine-induced apoptosis
Readout description.Result Description: After staurosporine treatment, cells overexpressing PINK1V317I showed significantly higher levels of apoptosis compared to wild-type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of apoptotic cells was obtained counting TUNEL-positive cells in 10 random microscopic fields from different slides in each of three replicates and expressed as the mean percentage (± standard error) of the total number of cells.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: one-way analysis of variance and post hoc multiple comparisons with Bonferroni correction

Material used.Description: Human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were grown in 5% CO2 in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum containing penicillin (100 U/mL) and streptomycin (50 lg/mL).

Readout description.Molecular Effect: abolish the protective effect of wild-type PINK1 against staurosporine-induced apoptosis
Readout description.Result Description: Activated caspase-3 levels were markedly reduced in PINK1wt, but not in PINK1A244G cells, when compared to controls.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: abolish the protective effect of wild-type PINK1 against staurosporine-induced apoptosis
Readout description.Result Description: Activated caspase-3 levels were markedly reduced in PINK1wt, but not in PINK1V317I cells, when compared to controls.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.
